answers.author: Cory Fleming
answers.text:
Jorie -
There aren't a whole lot of regional 311 systems right now, but there are a few city/county systems, such as Miami-Dade County (FL), City and County of Denver (CO), City and County of San Francisco (CA), City of Indianapolis and Marion County (IN).  I'm not sure if any of them use an IVR for call routing purposes or not, but please let me know if you'd like contact information for any of these folks.

answers.author: Clay Krauss
answers.text:
We are looking at implementing a 311/Regional 311 in Tacoma, WA.  Is there any new, relevant information regarding this topic?

author: Jorie Bresnahan
text:
The Phoenix Metro area is in very early stage development of a 311 system. Our local leaders would like a system that gives maximum independence to the individual jurisdiction. 
Does anyone have experience or know of a regional 311 system that starts with the caller identifying their jurisdiction of concern through IVR to be routed to separate agencies?
Any info you can provide would be much appreciated.
Jorie Bresnahan
City of Phoenix
title: Regional Multi Agency 311
